data.title: Senior Home Care Services
data.meta_description: Our senior home care services provide compassionate and reliable home care to the elderly in Livonia, MI. Contact Visiting Angels today to learn more.
data.text:
Visiting Angels Plymouth-Canton is proud to serve Livonia, MI, which has a population of over 95,000 people and is located 20 miles from Detroit’s city center. Interestingly, Livonia is named after Livonia, New York due to the European- American migrants who settled there from New England and New York. And how many cities can claim to have six U.S presidents as past residents? Richard Nixon, Gerald Ford, Ronald Reagan, George H. W. Bush, Bill Clinton and George W. Bush have all lived in the city at one point in their lives.

The rich history of Livonia is just one of the reasons senior citizens and their families will find this such an appealing place to live. The area boasts a plethora of fun activities throughout the year, ample senior housing options, top-notch medical facilities, and more.

Recreational Opportunities

The bustling city of Livonia has a full calendar of family-friendly events throughout the year. Residents of all ages can enjoy an alumni game between the Detroit Red Wings and Livonia All Stars, a monthly History Lecture Series, the Summer Flea Market, the Motor City Irish Festival, a Big Annual Picnic, and so much more. There are so many opportunities for senior citizens to engage with the local community and bring their family along too!

Senior Housing

Seniors and their families will be comforted to know there are several housing facilities that cater to aging loved ones such as Oakmont Livonia Senior Community, American House Senior Living Community, Silver Village, Parkside of Livonia, and Maycrest Heights. Visiting Angels Plymouth-Canton caregivers are also available to transport clients to locations throughout the community to ensure they have easy access to medical facilities, the grocery store, and more.

Medical Facilities

Livonia is home to several medical facilities such as Livonia Medical Center, Livonia Health Center, Ascension Providence Hospital, and Trinity Health Livonia Hospital. Nearby cities like Ann Arbor and Detroit also offer nationally-renowned medical facilities such as the University of Michigan Hospital and Beaumont Hospital, so all can feel confident knowing the best health care facilities are close by.

Transportation

The city of Livonia is dedicated to its aging population and this is evident through its Livonia Community Transit (LCT) system which services seniors 60 years and older and disabled residents. The service provides access to doctor appointments, shopping areas, medical appointments, salons, and employment and volunteer commitments. In addition, Livonia supports its Veteran residents through LCT services to the VA Hospital in Ann Arbor.

Supportive Organizations

The Civic Park Senior Center boasts a full calendar of activities for seniors to participate in throughout the year that include a travel club, machine quilt-making classes, an Alzheimer’s support group, vision impaired and blind support group, and more. The Center provides a full range of opportunities for seniors to stay healthy and fit that include yoga and meditation, table tennis, health and blood pressure screenings, and more.

Livonia, located within just a short driving distance from both Ann Arbor and Detroit, provides all the amenities seniors could need to live a fruitful and fulfilling life. Visiting Angels Plymouth-Canton is ready to support your aging loved one in the Livonia area when the time is right.

Contact us today for a free consultation to inquire about senior in-home and palliative care in Livonia, Michigan.
